intro: Omphalea occidentalis, commonly known as the western crown-beard, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, spiny capsules that contain numerous small, smooth seeds. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Omphalea occidentalis thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along stream banks.
